newsitem.title: MEXICO: Mexico peso stronger on capital inflow.
newsitem.headline: Mexico peso stronger on capital inflow.

text.p: The Mexican peso extended early gains at mid-morning trade on Tuesday due to foreign capital flow into local financial markets, traders said.
"Dollars are in supply, there is much confidence due to (Bill) Clinton's visit and that has also fueled dollar inflow," a trader said, referring to the official visit to Mexico by the U.S. president.
The benchmark 48-hour peso and its 24-hour counterpart both stood 3.3 centavos firmer at 7.8740/7.8770 and 7.8710/7.8740 per dollar, respectively.
Same-day peso contracts had meanwhile closed 3.15 centavos firmer at 7.8680/7.8715 per dollar.
